meanings.definition: The quality of being graceful and stylish in appearance or manner.
meanings.sent1: She displayed great elegancies in her movements at the dance.
meanings.sent2: The ballroom was filled with the elegancies of the nobility.
meanings.sent3: The cat walked with such elegancies that it seemed to be dancing.
meanings.sent4: Her words flowed with the elegancies of a skilled poet.
meanings.sent5: The garden was decorated with colorful flowers, adding natural elegancies to the surroundings.

meanings.definition: Refinement and good taste in behavior or style.
meanings.sent1: His speech was filled with eloquence and elegancies.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant's decor reflected the elegancies of French design.
meanings.sent3: The monkey showed surprising elegancies in its table manners.
meanings.sent4: The painting captured the elegancies of a bygone era.
meanings.sent5: The old mansion exuded the elegancies of a time long past.
